alert.note: Alert for Boundary (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 1:24AM MDT until June 17 at 6:55AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following county, Boundary. * WHEN...Until 330 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1224 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in and below the steep terrain of the Russell Mountain burn scar. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen so far. - Russell Mountain burn scar is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Ball Creek road, Trout Creek road, and Westside roads may experience water over the roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Boundary County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
